headline: Arizona Rep. Paul Gosar will not be a 'special guest' at neo-Nazi event, campaign says
sentences:
+8
View gallery
Paul Gosar allegedly promoted appearing at the neo-Nazi American Populist Union (APU) event to be held in Tempe, Arizona, on Hitler's birthday, April 20
+8
View gallery
 Gosar was listed as a featured guest speaker at the mixer, but his campaign consultant, Rory McShane, said on Wednesday that he had not approved Gosar's appearance
+8
View gallery
The APU advertised the mixer as a 'chance to meet some of the best legislatures, best people running for office, and media personalities in the country,' selling regular tickets at $45 and VIP tickets at $60.

+8
View gallery
Marjorie Taylor Greene (center) denied knowing white nationalist Nick Fuentes (right) despite taking a picture together with him and right-wing pundit Michelle Malkin during his America First Political Action Conference in Orlando in February
+8
View gallery
Greene was a special guest at Fuentes' AFPAC event to talk about 'God and liberty'
Gosar is a close ally of former President Donald Trump's and embraced his false claims that the election was stolen from him.

Above, Gosar pictured at the conference in 2021
+8
View gallery
Before his sudden change of heart about Nick Fuentes, Gosar defended him after finding out that he was being investigated by the January 6 Capitol riot committee
Another Republican firebrand, Georgia Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene, attended the America First February rally in February 2021 and 2022, run by Fuentes' group, in person.

+8
View gallery
On Thursday, the APU put out an statement noting that the April 20 date was 'was a logistical decision made based on venue availability - and nothing more'
Gosar blamed his pre-recorded video appearance at the February 26 America First Political Action Conference on miscommunication issues with staff members, who sent the video to the wrong group.

The APU advertised the mixer as a 'chance to meet some of the best legislatures (sic), best people running for office, and media personalities in the country,' selling regular tickets at $45 and VIP tickets at $60.

Gosar, who has held office as Arizona's Fourth District since 2013, previously came under fire last year for sharing a photoshopped anime video online that showed him killing New York Rep. Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez.

After speaking at the event, Greene posed in a photo with Fuentes and right-wing pundit Michelle Malkin, but when questioned about her appearance at AFPAC and relationship with Fuentes, Greene denied she knew him.

The video shows a sword-wielding character with Gosar's superimposed face using a jetpack to soar onto a rooftop before attacking Ocasio-Cortez, striking her with the weapon as blood flies out of her.
She went on to explain that she appeared at Fuentes' AFPAC event to talk about 'God and liberty', and reach out to his young followers because 'it's a generation I'm extremely concerned about.'
'The phony January 6th Committee's partisan witch-hunt continues as they have now set their sights on young conservative Christians like Nick Fuentes,' Gosar wrote on the social media site Gab.
According to the Anti-Defamation League, the organization 'champions anti-immigration and anti-LGBTQ+ sentiments and regards the modern GOP as a corrupt, globalist conservative establishment.'
The remarks by Gosar's campaign strategist come just a week after the controversial congressman said he regretted having appeared at another white-nationalist conference earlier this year.
Arizona GOP Rep. Paul Gosar was listed as a featured guest speaker at a neo-Nazi event scheduled on Adolf Hitler's birthday, but his campaign has since denied that he will attend.
Fuentes, who has been described as a white supremacist by the Anti-Defamation League, founded AFPAC in 2020 to rival the popular Conservative Political Action Conference.
On Thursday, the organization put out an statement noting that the April 20 date was 'was a logistical decision made based on venue availability - and nothing more.'

+8
View gallery
Gosar blamed his pre-recorded video appearance at the February 26 America First Political Action Conference on miscommunication issues with staff.
Before his sudden change of heart about Fuentes, Gosar, along with Greene, sought to create an America First Caucus in Congress, The Arizona Central reported.
The politician promoted appearing at the American Populist Union (APU) event to be held in Tempe, Arizona, on April 20, The Arizona Mirror first reported.
Politico reported Gosar told his colleagues that he didn't intend to encourage violence, but was trying to appeal to 'a younger audience.'
He has gained infamy for making many anti-Semitic comments, denying the Holocaust happened and opposing women's right to vote.
'It wasn't supposed to go to Nick's group,' Gosar told Politico, referring to the organization's leader, Nick Fuentes.
He also defended Fuentes after finding out that he was being investigated by the January 6 Capitol riot committee.
But Gosar's campaign consultant, Rory McShane, said on Wednesday that he had not approved Gosar's appearance.
'The young people that were being misled by somebody - we should be trying to mentor, trying to change them.
The conference will be hosted by the APU, a non-profit linked to white-supremacist and neo-Nazi ideals.
'I never approved this event and have never spoken to this group,' McShane told The Washington Post.
Fuente, a Holocaust-denier, has said he and Gosar will continue to collaborate 'behind the scenes.'
'The liberal media have recklessly claimed I am the author of a document,' he said in a statement.
In fact, I first became aware of it by reading about it in the news ... like everyone else.'
'I do not know what his views are so I am not aligned with anything that is controversial.'
Conservatives can't gather because someone was born 48,309 days ago?
'I have never heard him speak, I have never seen a video [of him].
'We're kind of short-handed ... And there was miscommunication.'
'I do not know Nick Fuentes,' Greene told CBS in February.
'Let me be perfectly clear, I did not author this paper.
Gosar later denied any involvement, as did Greene.
Nick's got a problem with his mouth,' Gosar said.
'The only event we have that day is a farm tour.'
Who cares?,' the APU Twitter account tweeted.
I've given up â€¦ on dealing with Nick.
'As for it being "HITLERS BIRTHDAY!"
We didn't even know; why would we?
Is this what we're doing now?
